metadata.chief_complaint: pre-K physical with developmental screening, parental concerns about speech and behavior

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good morning! I'm Dr. Martinez. You must be Emma, and you're here for your pre-K physical today.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, that's right. I'm Sarah, her mom. Emma, can you say hi to the doctor?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Hi doctor lady.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi Emma! I love your princess shirt. So you're going to start pre-K soon - that's so exciting! Mom, what brings you in today besides the school physical?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Well, we need the forms for school, but I'm also concerned about her speech. She's hard to understand sometimes, and her behavior has been challenging lately.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I see. Can you tell me more about the speech concerns? When did you first notice this?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: It's been ongoing, but it seems worse lately. Strangers can't understand her, and even I have trouble sometimes. She gets frustrated and has tantrums.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Emma, can you tell me your favorite color?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Puh-pul! I like puh-pul!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Purple is beautiful! And what do you like to do for fun?

script.speaker: child
script.text: I like to daw and pay wif my dolls.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: See what I mean? She's trying to say 'draw' and 'play with' but the sounds aren't clear.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I can hear some of those speech patterns. Let's talk about the behavioral concerns too. What kinds of behaviors are you seeing?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Lots of tantrums, especially when she can't communicate what she wants. She hits sometimes, and she doesn't follow directions well.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Those behaviors often go hand in hand with communication difficulties. Has she had any ear infections or hearing concerns?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: She had a few ear infections as a baby, but nothing recent. Her hearing seems fine - she responds to everything.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good to know. Any concerns about her development otherwise? Is she potty trained, can she dress herself, things like that?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: She's been potty trained for about six months. She can put on simple clothes but needs help with buttons and zippers. She knows her colors and can count to ten.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That all sounds very age-appropriate. Emma, show me how you can hop on one foot!

script.speaker: child
script.text: Look! Look! I can do it!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Wow, you're so good at that! Now let's check your body to make sure everything is healthy. Is it okay if I listen to your heart?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Okay. Is it gonna hurt?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Not at all, it just feels cool. Here we go.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Your heart sounds perfect. Now I'm going to look in your ears - this might tickle a little.

script.speaker: child
script.text: That tickles! Hehe!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Your ears look great, no fluid or infection. Let me check your throat now - can you say 'ahh' like a lion?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Ahhhh! Roar!

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Perfect! Everything looks healthy. Now Emma, can you walk across the room for me like you're on a balance beam?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Like dis?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Exactly like that! You have great balance. Can you draw a circle for me on this paper?

script.speaker: child
script.text: I daw lots of circles! See?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Those are wonderful circles! Now Mom, let's talk about what I'm seeing. Emma is developmentally on track in most areas, but I do hear the speech articulation issues you mentioned.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: So what do we do about it? Will it affect her starting school?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Many children Emma's age have some articulation challenges, and most schools are very accommodating. I'd recommend a speech evaluation to determine if she needs therapy.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: How do I get that set up? And what about the behavior issues?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'll give you a referral for speech therapy. As for behavior, it often improves once communication gets easier. We can also discuss some strategies.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Mommy, I hungry.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: We'll eat after we're done, sweetie. Sorry, doctor.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: No problem at all. Emma, you've been such a good patient today. Let me finish talking with your mom, okay?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: For school, she'll need her immunizations updated. She needs her second varicella vaccine and her pre-K boosters.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay, we can do those today. When should I expect to hear about the speech evaluation?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Usually within two to three weeks. In the meantime, read to her daily, speak clearly, and don't correct her - just model the correct sounds naturally.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: That's helpful, thank you. I feel better having a plan.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: She's a delightful little girl, and with some support, I expect she'll do wonderfully in pre-K. Let's get those vaccines taken care of, shall we?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Do I get a sticker?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: You absolutely get a sticker! You can pick any one you want from my special sticker box.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Yay! Thank you doctor lady!

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thank you so much, Dr. Martinez. This was exactly what we needed.
